page.title: 14Railways.
page.content: Two railways pass through{Hazel {Grove.}In 1854, the Stockport, Disley and Whaley Bridge Company built a railway from Edgeley to Whaley Bridge, including a station at{Hazel Grove. The line opened in 1847 and was later extended to Buxton and is still in use. The other was built by Midland Railway in 1902 to provide an express route from Buxton to London via Macclesfield. Another station was built on the eastern side of{Hazel {Grove.}It closed to passengers in 1917. The line to{Hazel Grove}from Edgeley was electrified and the Station rebuilt in 1977.In 1985 work started on a scheme to link these two lines to provide a route through to Sheffield.This is probably the only part of the railway system to be built for a long time. A new 'halt type station will have to be built.
